title: How to Make a Messy Bun With Extremely Long Hair

steps.title: Brush your hair out to make it detangled.
steps.content: Brush your hair out to make it detangled. Don't wash it for better results; messy buns only work in "dirty" hair. You can use dry shampoo to achieve the necessary texture.

steps.title: Put your hair in a bun the size of an apple (depends on how long your hair is).
steps.content: Put your hair in a bun the size of an apple (depends on how long your hair is).

steps.title: Twist the rest around the bun until the last strand of hair (hide the wrapping a little).
steps.content: Twist the rest around the bun until the last strand of hair (hide the wrapping a little).

steps.title: Tuck the tip of your hair in your hair tie (you could just put another hair band on to support your overall look in general).
steps.content: Tuck the tip of your hair in your hair tie (you could just put another hair band on to support your overall look in general).

steps.title: Lightly gel up the tips and middle section of your hair.
steps.content: Lightly gel up the tips and middle section of your hair. This helps the strands stick together and keep your bun from collapsing.

steps.title: Put your hair in a ponytail.
steps.content: Put your hair in a ponytail.

steps.title: Place your hand where the ponytail holder is up on your head.
steps.content: Place your hand where the ponytail holder is up on your head. This secures it in place.

steps.title: Take your other hand and twist the ponytail until it twirls up against your head.
steps.content: Take your other hand and twist the ponytail until it twirls up against your head.

steps.title: Secure it with a hair tie.
steps.content: Secure it with a hair tie.

steps.title: Lightly gel up the edges near the hair tie with gel.
steps.content: Lightly gel up the edges near the hair tie with gel.

steps.title: Carefully pull out small strands of hair.
steps.content: Carefully pull out small strands of hair. You may set the look with hairspray.
